newsitem.title: UK: Denby slides after gloomy interim statement.
newsitem.headline: Denby slides after gloomy interim statement.

text.p: Shares in UK pottery and china group Denby Group Plc tumbled 10 percent on Thursday after the company issued a bleak results statement as it reported half-year figures, dealers said.
The shares dropped 24-1/2p to 223p by 0746 GMT in volume of only 8,500 shares.

Denby made pre-tax profits of 3.5 million stg in the six months to March 1997, an increase of 15.7 percent on the same period last year, but warned competitive pressures were increasing in all markets.
Chairman Ray Way said order flow in the UK had been particularly disappointing in April and May and growth rates had eased in several overseas markets due to the strength of sterling.
However, Way said the group remained committed to international expansion and had changed the group's structure to increase its focus on brand development and manufacturing efficiency.
